conclusion: Identify the need to find the sine value of the refraction angle of monochromatic light B at the boundary of the small circular area.
Point light source S underwater emits monochromatic light A and B; refractive index for A is n1 and for B is n2.
Small circle is illuminated by polychromatic light, large circle by monochromatic light B.
Light travels from water (refractive index n) to air (refractive index 1), bending away from the normal.
Critical angle C for total internal reflection is given by sin C = 1/n.
Critical angles for light A and B are sin CA = 1/n1 and sin CB = 1/n2.
Light reaching the boundary of the small circle will have a critical angle denoted as θ.
For monochromatic light B, find the sine of the refraction angle at the boundary.
Light B reaching the boundary has its refraction angle determined by sin θ = 1/n2.
The sine value of the refraction angle θ for monochromatic light B at the boundary is sin θ = 1/n2.
